Utterance: Hi there! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been okay. I reached out to Sarah, and we talked for a bit.
That’s wonderful news! How did that conversation go?
It felt good to talk to her. She was really supportive and understood what I’m going through.
I’m glad to hear that! It sounds like reconnecting with her was beneficial. Did you feel any relief after the conversation?
Yeah, definitely. It felt nice to share my feelings with someone who gets it.
That’s fantastic. Having a support system can make a big difference. Have you been able to practice the mindfulness exercises we discussed?
Yes, I’ve been trying to do it every morning. It helps me start the day on a better note.
That’s great to hear! How has it impacted your overall mood throughout the day?
I’ve noticed that I’m less reactive to stress. I can take a moment to breathe before responding to things.
Classified_Subsection: History of Present Illness (HPI):Mental Health Observations

Utterance: That’s a significant improvement! It sounds like you’re building a solid foundation for managing your anxiety. Have you had a chance to get back into running?
I went for a short jog a couple of times. It felt amazing to be outside and move again.
That’s wonderful! Physical activity can be such a great outlet for stress. How did you feel afterward?
Exhausted but in a good way. It’s like I released a lot of pent-up energy.
That’s exactly the benefit of exercise. It can help clear your mind and boost your mood. Are you planning to continue running?
Yes, I want to make it a regular part of my routine again.
That’s a great goal. Consistency is key. Have you noticed any changes in your interactions with friends or family since implementing these strategies?
I’ve been more open with my friends. I even invited Sarah to hang out this weekend.
That’s fantastic! It sounds like you’re making strides in building those connections. How do you feel about spending time with friends again?
I’m excited! I think it’ll be good to have some fun and take my mind off things.
Definitely! It’s important to find joy amidst the challenges. Speaking of challenges, how have things been with your custody situation?
It’s still stressful, but I feel like I’m handling it better. I’m trying to focus on what I can control.
That’s a healthy mindset. Focusing on what you can control can help reduce feelings of helplessness. Have you been able to set any boundaries with your family regarding the situation?
I’ve started to limit conversations with my mom. It’s hard, but I know it’s necessary.
That sounds like a positive step for your mental health. Setting boundaries can be difficult, but it’s essential for your well-being. How does it feel to take that step?
It feels empowering. I’m tired of letting her affect my mood.
That’s a significant realization. Remember, it’s okay to prioritize your mental health. Do you feel like you have the tools to maintain those boundaries?
I think so. I just need to stay firm and not let her manipulate me.
Absolutely. It’s about protecting your peace. If you ever feel overwhelmed, you can always use mindfulness or reach out to Sarah for support.
I will. I’m learning that it’s okay to ask for help.
That’s a great insight. Remember, you’re not alone in this. As we wrap up today, what are some goals you’d like to set for our next session?
I want to keep working on my self-care routine and maybe explore more coping strategies for the custody battle.
That sounds like a solid plan. We can definitely explore additional coping strategies. How about we also set a goal for you to try a new self-care activity this week?
I’d like that! Maybe I can try yoga or something relaxing.
Yoga could be a wonderful addition! It combines mindfulness with movement. Let’s aim for that.
Okay, I’ll look for a class or some online videos.
Perfect! I’m looking forward to hearing about your experiences next time. Remember, take it one step at a time.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate your guidance.
You’re doing great work. Take care, and I’ll see you next week!
Bye!
Bye!
